This website is an introduction to OPA - the Open Post Academic Mentorship Program which is incubated through the [Mozilla Open Leaders program](https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/opportunity/mozilla-open-leaders/open-leaders-x/participants/).  

<center>The first cohort of the program will launch in January 2020.</center> 

<center>**We will be accepting applications beginning November 1st.**</center>   

<br> 
Make sure you're on the [mailing list](https://mailchi.mp/2932ae7328f2/opa) to receive updates about the program!   

### Purpose 
To empower people with a PhD to share their knowledge and skills more openly. 

### Objectives 
- To expand the network of participants to more people outside of academia 
- For participants to understand their skill set and how to apply those abilities to projects outside of academia.
- To create a project that shares those skills openly. 


### Are you interested? 
If you are interested in becoming a mentor, a part of the expert pool or a participant, please [sign up to receive updates](https://mailchi.mp/2932ae7328f2/opa). 

We will also be hosting webinars where you can learn more information about the program and ask any questions not covered by the [FAQ](https://openpostac.org/FAQ.html). Sign up for the best time for you! 

* [Friday, Nov 8, 2019 01:00 PM PST](https://mailchi.mp/974995dc1c79/1ixanw306k)
* [Tuesday, Nov 12, 2019 09:00 AM PST](https://mailchi.mp/2f5ab07c245e/5h7tkejk9h)
* [Tuesday, Nov 12, 2019 05:00 PM PST](https://mailchi.mp/30692b078a57/lwrs99kv4q)

All times are Pacific Standard Time for the US and Canada: UTC-8 and the event will last one hour with plenty of time for Q&A.
